article.headline: Virginia Tech 54, Western Carolina 40
article.story: BLACKSBURG, Va. (AP) -- Guard Jamon Gordon had 11 points and 10 rebounds Sunday to lead Virginia Tech to a 54-40 victory over Western Carolina in the NABC Classic. The Catamounts (1-2) went on a 12-0 run to take a 14-6 lead. Coleman Collins scored to give Virginia Tech (2-1) an 18-16 lead, but the Catamounts closed the half with a 7-2 run to take a 23-20 lead. Virginia Tech was 3-of-18 from the field in the first half but stayed in it by hitting 13 of 17 free throws. Deron Washington stole the ball and was fouled and his free throws with 18:24 left gave the Hokies the lead for good at 24-23. Markus Sailes scored 13 points and Washington and Zabian Dowdell each had 10 for the Hokies. David Berghoefer led the Catamounts with 11 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
